title: Coaching & Mentoring Programmes - STLA - SIT

meta.description: Initiatives organised by SIT Teaching and Learning Academy (STLA) for academic staff to develop their skills and become more effective coaches and mentors to their students.

text_lines: To support the development of versatile educators who can perform the role of Teacher-Coach-Mentor, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy (STLA) offers coaching and mentoring programmes for academic staff.

Research shows that coaching and mentoring has a positive impact on student learning outcomes and academic staff development. Through the adoption of coaching and mentoring, academic staff can engage students on a deeper level, enabling students to develop confidence and self-efficacy, and to achieve their fullest potential.
Coaching as an SIT Educator Workshop
This signature STLA workshop is highly contextualised for the needs of SIT academic staff as it focuses on managing students in classroom situations and the Integrated Work Study Programme (IWSP).
Be able to immediately apply the skills in their work with students
Have the opportunity to share their experiences with one other
Community of Practice (CoP) for Coaching and Mentoring
The purpose of the CoP is to nurture a learning community that supports academic staff on their journey as coaches and mentors at SIT.
The CoP also provides a supportive community for sharing best practices and exploring topics of interest related to coaching and mentoring.

Coach Academy is a digital platform where you can find links to useful coaching and mentoring content. We have curated materials from leading academic researchers and industry practitioners who are well established in the field. The information is organised as follows:
Contact our Coaching & Mentoring Trainer, Mr Ramesh Shahdadpuri at
for details on our coaching and mentoring programmes or the CoP, or simply to start a conversation about leading and empowering others along their learning journeys.

An orientation programme for new academic staff to understand applied learning and teaching approaches.

article_texts:
Coaching & Mentoring Programmes
For all academic staff
To support the development of versatile educators who can perform the role of Teacher-Coach-Mentor, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy (STLA) offers coaching and mentoring programmes for academic staff.
Research shows that coaching and mentoring has a positive impact on student learning outcomes and academic staff development. Through the adoption of coaching and mentoring, academic staff can engage students on a deeper level, enabling students to develop confidence and self-efficacy, and to achieve their fullest potential.
Our Current Initiatives
Title
Duration
Dates
Details
Coaching as an SIT Educator Workshop
2 days
14-15 April 2025
04-05 August 2025
25-26 August 2025
13-14 October 2025
01-02 December 2025
This signature STLA workshop is highly contextualised for the needs of SIT academic staff as it focuses on managing students in classroom situations and the Integrated Work Study Programme (IWSP).
Participants will:
Gain hands-on coaching experience
Be able to immediately apply the skills in their work with students
Have the opportunity to share their experiences with one other
Community of Practice (CoP) for Coaching and Mentoring
Ongoing
The purpose of the CoP is to nurture a learning community that supports academic staff on their journey as coaches and mentors at SIT.
The CoP also provides a supportive community for sharing best practices and exploring topics of interest related to coaching and mentoring.
Current tracks:
Coaching Conversations @SIT
Coaching Circles @SIT
View more resources

Coach Academy is a digital platform where you can find links to useful coaching and mentoring content. We have curated materials from leading academic researchers and industry practitioners who are well established in the field. The information is organised as follows:
